icap
Class ConnectionsPool

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      icap.ConnectionsPool
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class ConnectionsPool
extends java.lang.Thread

PoolThreads class allow to manage a thread pool for client connections. Pool is set to nbThreads size, and managed threads must implement a method assignTask(Socket sock). These threads are used to manage clients connections.

Version:
1.0
Author:
k.mittig

Constructor Detail

ConnectionsPool

public ConnectionsPool(IcapServer _server,
                       int size,
                       java.lang.reflect.Constructor<? extends AbstractService> constructor)
Initialize an pool of "size" threads

Parameters:
_server - ICAP Server managing the connection pool
size - Pool size (number of possible threads)
constructor - The ICAP service constructor
Method Detail

disable

public void disable()
Disable all threads in the pool

assignTask

public void assignTask(java.net.Socket sock)
Server receive clients connection requests and send them to assignTask method each time. This task is given to one sleeping thread if available, otherwise stored in a buffer.

Parameters:
sock - The pending socket to proceed

restoreInPool

public java.net.Socket restoreInPool(AbstractService thread)
Each thread call this method when it finishes its task If there is awaiting command in buffer, thread takes it and restart. Otherwise, it put itself in available threads and in sleep mode.

Parameters:
thread - Thread that has finished its work and returns into pool
Returns:
a pending socket if any is waiting, null otherwise.
